paragraph.paragraph: This sample shows you how to respond to an event occurring within your application. It also demonstrates the use of a ../../../reference/support/WEL_MSG_BOX_chart.xmlWEL_MSG_BOX control and a redefinition of closeable from ../../../reference/windows/WEL_COMPOSITE_WINDOW_chart.xmlWEL_COMPOSITE_WINDOW.
paragraph.heading: 2Compiling
paragraph.paragraph: To see compiling instructions, you have to enable javascript.
paragraph.heading: 2Running
paragraph.paragraph: After launching the sample, you should see a ../../../reference/windows/WEL_FRAME_WINDOW_chart.xmlWEL_FRAME_WINDOW displayed. If you click the left mouse button in the client area of the window, a ../../../reference/support/WEL_MSG_BOX_chart.xmlWEL_MSG_BOX will appear, notifying you of your click.
paragraph.heading: 2Under the Hood
paragraph.paragraph:
This system is a demonstration of how to connect an event to one of the common message hooks available within WEL. See
/libraries/wel/content/common_concepts/index.xmlcommon_message_hooks Common message hooks for more information. In this example, on_left_button_down has been redefined from ../../../reference/windows/WEL_WINDOW_chart.xmlWEL_WINDOW to display a ../../../reference/support/WEL_MSG_BOX_chart.xmlWEL_MSG_BOX containing notification of the event occuring.

If you look at closeable from MAIN_WINDOW, you will see that it has been redefined to display a ../../../reference/support/WEL_MSG_BOX_chart.xmlWEL_MSG_BOX and the result from this message box is used to generate the return value of closeable. If this Result is True, the window will be closed. This sample contains the following classes:
TUTORIAL_STEP2
MAIN_WINDOW
